definitions: lacking in completeness or detail; roughly outlined or hastily done
appearing dishonest, unreliable, or of questionable legality or safety
examples: The artist made a sketchy outline before painting
We only have sketchy details about the incident
That neighborhood looks pretty sketchy at night
The dealer seemed sketchy so we left immediately

definitions: positioned or turned at an angle; neither parallel nor perpendicular to something
examples: The picture frame hung skew on the wall
The skew lines never intersect in geometry

definitions: unfairly biased or presenting a misleading or partial view of something
turned or placed at an angle; not straight or aligned properly
examples: The survey results were skewed by poor methodology
His skewed perspective ignored important facts
The shelf was skewed after the earthquake
The skewed fence posts needed straightening

definitions: having or showing skill, expertise, or accomplishment in a particular activity
examples: The skilful surgeon completed the delicate operation
She made a skilful argument in court

definitions: having acquired mastery through training, practice, or specialized education
demonstrating ability, competence, or expertise in performing tasks
examples: The factory needs more skilled workers for assembly
Skilled nurses provide specialized patient care
She's skilled at negotiating complex contracts
The skilled carpenter built beautiful furniture

definitions: possessing or demonstrating skill, expertise, or accomplishment in an activity
examples: The skillful pianist played the complex piece perfectly
His skillful handling of the crisis impressed everyone

definitions: having had the cream or fat removed, especially referring to milk products
examples: She prefers skim milk in her coffee
The recipe calls for skim yogurt instead

definitions: from which the cream or fat has been removed, especially milk products
examples: Skimmed milk contains less than one percent fat
The skimmed version has fewer calories overall

definitions: having had the skin or outer covering removed or peeled off
having skin of a specified type, used in combination with other words
examples: The skinned chicken was ready for cooking
Skinned tomatoes work better in this sauce
The fair-skinned child needed extra sun protection
Dark-skinned people have more natural sun protection

definitions: unattractively thin or having very little flesh on the bones
made with non-fat or low-fat ingredients, especially in beverages
examples: The skinny cat looked like it hadn't eaten properly
Her skinny arms showed she needed better nutrition
She ordered a skinny latte with soy milk
The skinny version uses sugar-free syrup instead

definitions: positioned along or around the edge or border of something
examples: The skirting boards needed fresh paint throughout
Skirting issues won't solve the underlying problem

definitions: relating to or characteristic of Andrew Jackson or his political principles and era
examples: Jacksonian democracy emphasized populist ideals strongly
The Jacksonian era saw significant political changes

definitions: relating to the reign of James I of England or the architectural and artistic style of that period
examples: The Jacobean mansion featured elaborate carved woodwork
Jacobean drama often explored dark psychological themes

definitions: relating to or characteristic of Jainism or its adherents and practices
examples: The Jain temple showcased intricate marble carvings
Jain philosophy emphasizes non-violence toward all beings

definitions: of, from, or relating to Jamaica, its people, or their culture
examples: Jamaican music has influenced artists worldwide significantly
The Jamaican cuisine features bold spices throughout

definitions: of, from, or relating to Japan, its people, language, or culture
examples: Japanese technology leads many global industries today
The Japanese garden created a peaceful atmosphere

definitions: of or relating to the island of Java, its people, or culture
examples: The Javan rhinoceros is critically endangered today
Javan culture reflects centuries of diverse influences

definitions: of or relating to Java, its people, language, or cultural traditions
examples: Javanese batik is recognized as world heritage
The Javanese language has several speech levels

definitions: relating to or characteristic of Thomas Jefferson or his political principles and philosophy
examples: Jeffersonian ideals shaped early American democracy profoundly
The Jeffersonian architecture emphasized classical Greek elements

definitions: relating to or characteristic of the Society of Jesus or its members
examples: Jesuit education emphasizes intellectual rigor and service
The Jesuit mission established schools throughout the region

definitions: relating to Jews, their religion, culture, or ethnic identity and traditions
examples: Jewish holidays follow the lunar calendar traditionally
The Jewish community celebrated Passover together this year

definitions: of, from, or relating to Jordan, its people, or their culture
examples: Jordanian hospitality is renowned throughout the region
The Jordanian economy relies heavily on tourism

definitions: relating to or resembling the planet Jupiter or its characteristics
examples: Jovian planets have thick gaseous atmospheres primarily
The Jovian moons include Europa and Ganymede

definitions: of or relating to Judaism, Jewish law, or Jewish religious practices
examples: Judaic studies explore Jewish history and texts
The museum displayed ancient Judaic artifacts carefully

definitions: relating to Julius Caesar or the calendar system he introduced
examples: The Julian calendar preceded the Gregorian system
Julian dates are still used in astronomy

definitions: relating to or characteristic of Carl Jung's psychological theories and methods
examples: Jungian analysis explores collective unconscious patterns deeply
The therapist used Jungian archetypes in treatment

definitions: younger or being the younger of two people with the same name
having a lower position, rank, or standing in an organization
examples: John Smith Junior inherited his father's business
The junior members attended their first meeting
Junior officers receive additional training each month
She started as a junior analyst last year

definitions: relating to the geological period between the Triassic and Cretaceous periods
examples: Jurassic fossils reveal diverse dinosaur species existed
The Jurassic period lasted approximately fifty million years

definitions: relating to or characteristic of the philosophy of Immanuel Kant
examples: Kantian ethics emphasizes duty and moral law
The professor explained Kantian categorical imperatives clearly

definitions: of or relating to Kashmir, its people, language, or culture
examples: Kashmiri shawls are prized for their intricate patterns
The Kashmiri language has ancient literary traditions

definitions: directed or moving toward the sky or upward into the air
examples: The rocket shot skyward with tremendous force
Birds flew skyward as the storm approached

definitions: loose or hanging down; not stretched tight or held firmly
showing little activity, effort, or care; negligent or lazy
examples: The slack rope couldn't support any weight
Keep the line slack until you feel a bite
Business was slack during the winter months
His slack attitude annoyed his hardworking colleagues

definitions: killed, especially in a violent or deliberate manner
examples: The slain soldiers were honored at the memorial
Police investigated the case of the slain businessman

definitions: containing or constituting slander; making false and damaging statements about someone
examples: The slanderous article damaged her professional reputation
He sued the newspaper for slanderous accusations

definitions: positioned at an angle rather than straight up or across
presented in a biased way to favor a particular viewpoint
examples: The slanted roof helped snow slide off easily
Sunlight streamed through the slanted blinds beautifully
The slanted coverage favored one political party
Her slanted interpretation ignored contradictory evidence completely

definitions: inclining from a horizontal or vertical position; tilted or angled
presenting information with deliberate bias or particular perspective
examples: The slanting rays created long shadows everywhere
Rain hit the slanting windows with considerable force
The slanting presentation misled many readers unfortunately
His slanting remarks revealed his true prejudices

definitions: characterized by broad physical comedy involving exaggerated actions and mishaps
examples: The slapstick comedy had audiences laughing hysterically
His slapstick humor relied on pratfalls mainly

definitions: marked or cut with long cuts or gashes
reduced dramatically or severely in amount or number
examples: The slashed tires couldn't be repaired easily
Her slashed jeans were the latest fashion
The store slashed prices for clearance sales
Budget cuts meant slashed funding for programs

definitions: making sweeping cuts with or as with a sharp instrument
severely critical or harsh in tone or manner
examples: The slashing rain stung their exposed faces
His slashing sword strokes defeated every opponent
Her slashing critique exposed numerous flaws thoroughly
The slashing review destroyed the play's reputation

definitions: sordid, corrupt, or morally degraded in character or quality
of very poor quality; cheap and shoddy in construction
examples: The sleazy nightclub attracted questionable characters regularly
His sleazy behavior made everyone uncomfortable immediately
The sleazy motel room smelled of mildew
She refused to buy the sleazy fabric

definitions: having a smooth, glossy surface or appearance, well-groomed
having an elegant, streamlined shape or design
examples: The cat's sleek fur shone in sunlight
Her sleek hair was perfectly styled today
The sleek sports car turned heads everywhere
His sleek laptop fit easily in briefcases

definitions: in the state of sleep or appearing to be asleep
temporarily inactive or dormant but capable of being activated
examples: The sleeping child looked peaceful and content
Don't wake the sleeping dog near the fireplace
The sleeping volcano hadn't erupted for centuries
Sleeping accounts can be reactivated anytime needed

definitions: characterized by or experiencing a lack of sleep; unable to sleep
examples: She spent another sleepless night worrying constantly
The sleepless parents tended their sick child

definitions: feeling drowsy and ready to fall asleep; showing signs of tiredness
quiet and showing little activity or excitement
examples: The sleepy toddler rubbed his tired eyes
She felt sleepy after the large meal
The sleepy village had only one store
Nothing happens in this sleepy little town

definitions: having sleeves of a specified type, usually used in combinations
examples: She wore a long-sleeved shirt for protection
The short-sleeved uniform was more comfortable

definitions: having no sleeves; with the arms left bare or uncovered
examples: The sleeveless dress was perfect for summer
He wore a sleeveless vest over his shirt

definitions: gracefully thin; having a small width in proportion to height or length
small or inadequate in amount, size, or degree
examples: The slender dancer moved with elegant grace
Slender columns supported the ancient temple roof
They won by a slender margin of votes
His slender income barely covered basic expenses

definitions: cut into thin, flat pieces or sections
examples: The sliced bread was ready for sandwiches
She arranged sliced tomatoes on the platter

definitions: having a smooth, wet, slippery surface
done or operating in an impressively smooth and efficient way, sometimes deceptively
examples: The slick roads caused several accidents today
Oil made the garage floor dangerously slick
His slick presentation impressed the investors greatly
The slick salesman convinced her to buy

definitions: moving smoothly along a surface while maintaining continuous contact
designed to slide for opening, closing, or adjusting
examples: The sliding motion helped reduce friction significantly
Children enjoyed the sliding game on ice
The sliding door saved space in the room
Sliding scale fees accommodate different income levels
